metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18258 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The xz_head function in xzlib.c in libxml2 before 2.9.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted LZMA file, because the decoder functionality does not restrict memory usage to what is required for a legitimate file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18258` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> precise/esm hasn't support for LZMA ccdm94> the fix for this issue seems to introduce the vulnerability related to CVE-2018-9251.

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6').
